body.p:
Danville 4 Oct 1864
To his Excy
Thos E Bramlette
Governor &c
Frankfort Ky
The undersigned would respectfully petition your excellency for the remission of a fine of twenty Dollars imposed on him under the following circumstances

He & his partner a young gentleman named Pendleton had made & registered their application with the Federal authorities to obtain the proper licence to sell spirituous liquors, ^in Boyle County^ and supposing that this gave them the license ^& one of^ them did sell to one John Simpson ^a drink^ for which they were arrested tried and yr petitioner was fined $20. The undersigned petitioner had no purpose to violate the law & did not know or believe he was violating law -- as he supposed his application for Federal licence gave him the right to sell -- he respectfully prays the remission of the fine save costs & attos fee which he has paid.
I the partner of Harness concur in his statement & petition T. J. S. Pendleton
I assessed the fine & concur in the within statements

Boyle Cir Ct
vs
W H. Harness
$20.
Remitted
6th Dec/64
